sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
A wonderful pleasant and profitable letter written by Mris Sarah Wight, to a friend, expressing the joy is to be had in God in great, deep, long, and sore afflictions. Occasioned by the death of her brother, the troubles of her mother; but especially the workings of God in her own heart. Published for the use of the afflicted. Wight, Sarah.
[6], 81, [1] p.
Printed by James Cottrel, for Ri. Moone, at the seven Stars in Pauls Church-yard., London, : 1656.
Annotation on Thomason copy: "8ber [i.e. October] 20". Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
=======
A wonderful pleasant and profitable letter written by Mris Sarah Wight, to a friend, expressing the joy is to be had in God in great, deep, long, and sore afflictions. Occasioned by the death of her brother, the troubles of her mother; but especially the workings of God in her own heart. Published for the use of the afflicted. Wight, Sarah.
[6], 81, [1] p.
Printed by James Cottrel, for Ri. Moone, at the seven Stars in Pauls Church-yard., London, : 1656.
Annotation on Thomason copy: "8ber [i.e. October] 20". Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
Ri. Moone
James Cottrel
the seven Stars in Pauls Church-yard.
